abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Project to Reverse Land and Water Degradation Trends in
            the Niger River Basin, which develops and implements
            sustainable measures for reversing trends in land and water
            degradation through collaborative decision-making in the
            Niger River Basin; strengthens NBA project execution and
            data management capacities; and formalizes consultative
            processes for basin-level environmental planning.  This
            report examines possible negative environmental impacts and
            proposes measures to offset them. To reduce soil erosion,
            encourage rapid regeneration of vegetation and avoid
            exploitative methods that deteriorate the soil. Limit the
            use of chemical fertilizers while encouraging the use of
            organic fertilizers. Only use pesticides in accordance with
            national and international standards, and continuously
            monitor that use. Control flooding, soil compaction, and
            salinization caused by temporary dams (weirs) construction.
            Use drainage systems and diversify land use. Limit livestock
            grazing. Inform tourists about good practices. To avoid
            water contamination, monitor its exploitation and regulate
            its use, and adopt water and soil conservation measures.
            Restore the vegetal cover as soon as possible after clearing
            for construction, avoid sloping, regulate grazing, renew
            forage production, and avoid planting species whose growth
            will be difficult to contain. Monitor biodiversity and
            consider impacts on animal habitats--such as toxic pesticide
            use, avoid introducing predators that might thin the native
            animal population. Teach tourists good practices in
            biodiversity conservation as well as inform them of legal
            requirements. Other mitigations include limiting access to
            protected areas, resettling displaced populations in
            appropriate areas where they will be financially compensated
            and be given access to health services, education, and
            adequate infrastructure; and have access to conflict
            resolution mechanisms in land use disputes. To control
            quality and reduce the risk of toxicity from pesticides on
            agricultural products, avoid aerial spraying and use
            approved products.
